content.description: Awesome, awesome, awesome.  a series of pumpy, crimpy, juggy, and incredibly varied climbing up a steep wall.  It is superclassic, and great endurance climbing is to be had.  Be careful you don't blow the second or third clip, the bolts are spaced just far enough to keep it interesting.
content.location: On the steep wall on the right, the central route. Usually has a lot of chalk up to the crux move, where the chalk dwindles significantly.

content.description: Several crimps and slopers, long reach helps.
content.protection: Several bolts to two bolt anchor, can walk around to the top to setup top rope.
content.location: Left of Solomon route, left of three routes next to each other on obvious south-facing wall.

content.description: The climb is a fairly consistent moderate grade. It starts off as a crack where you can place gear; about three pieces should be fine. Then turns into a ledge where the rest of the climb is bolted.
content.protection: Some trad gear at the bottom and quickdraw.
content.location: First climb on the left in the Solomon's Area. Trees cover the base.

content.description: Easy low angle climb with small roof at top.
content.location: To the right of triple roofed run out climb. Nice shaded belay station.

content.description: Medium sized holds and several spots to rest. You can start to left of the first bolt which is blocky and pretty easy (~5.5), or to the right in a crack that is more fun (~5.7). The crux is about half way up where a you have to traverse right onto a bulge. Like all the climbs in the area, one can walk to the top to setup a top rope.
content.protection: Several bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Far right side of soloman area, 2 minute hike from Cupcake up scree.

content.description: Big roof, a couple of long reaches. Holds are positive and pumpy.
content.location: On Solomon's Wall, between Solomon's and Cupcake

content.description: Freaking awesome!  if you catch it on a day when it is void of hundreds of prescott college students, you will be able to climb here, and surely enjoy it.
